oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bond sales drive in downtown Nashville by the Army, Navy, and Civic Clubs, 1942 September
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A scene from the Bond Sales Drive by the Army, Navy, and Civic Clubs, on 6th Avenue N in downtown Nashville, Tennessee, with “Street of Flags.” By the end of the war, over 85 million Americans had invested in War Bonds, raising $185.7 billion to finance the war effort. Forms part of Record Group 412, Photographs Collection. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Zanini's Restaurant (Nashville, Tenn.); Cross Keys Restaurant (Nashville, Tenn.); Jenson & Jeck (Nashville, Tenn.)
